text:
In this section you'll learn about two more types of note.
Previously you learnt about crotchets, which are each one beat long.

A minim has a stem that can go up or down and the note head isn't coloured in black.
A minim lasts for two beats.
Click on the minim note.
explanation: Crotchets and minims do look similar, but the minim is not coloured in black.
feedback: The note with a black head and a stem is a crotchet.
You have clicked on the minim.

text: A minim lasts for two crotchet beats.
A semibreve doesn't have a stem at all and it lasts for four beats.
Click on the semibreve note.
explanation: A semibreve is the one without the stem.
feedback: This is a minim. Go back and check what a semibreve looks like.
Excellent!

text: Click on the minim note.
explanation: Remember that minim notes have a stem.
feedback: You have clicked on the semibreve. Remember that the minims have stems but semibreves do not.
Well done!

text: A semibreve lasts for two minims, or four crotchet beats.
We know that there are two quavers in a crotchet...
...and two crotchets in a minim.
How many quavers in a minim?
explanation: Two quavers equals one crotchet, so four quavers equals two crotchets.
feedback: Four quavers fit into the time of a minim.
Two quavers fit into one crotchet, so your chosen answer is too short.

text: Click on the note that lasts for two crotchet beats.
explanation: There are two crotchets in a minim.
feedback: A quaver lasts for half a crotchet.
This is a crotchet! We are looking for a note that lasts for twice this long.
That's right!

text: Click on the note that lasts for four crotchet beats.
explanation: There are four crotchets in a semibreve.
feedback: A semibreve lasts for four beats.
This is a single crotchet. We are looking for the note that lasts four times this long.
This is a minim, a note which lasts for two beats.

text: Let's revise all of the note values we've covered so far. Here they are in order from longest to shortest, starting with the semibreve. Each note has another black element added to make it shorter.
A semibreve (4 beats) with a stem added is a minim (2 beats).
A minim (2 beats) with its head coloured in is a crotchet (1 beat).
A crotchet (1 beat) with a tail added is a quaver (half of a beat).
A quaver (half a beat) with another tail added is a semiquaver (quarter of beat).
Click on the semibreve, the note which lasts for four beats.
feedback: This is the semibreve (4 beats).
This is the minim (2 beats).
This is the crotchet (1 beat).

This is the semiquaver (quarter of a beat).
